skill.name: skill-writer
skill.description: Guide users through creating Agent Skills for Claude Code. Use when the user wants to create, write, author, or design a new Skill, or needs help with SKILL.md files, frontmatter, or skill structure.
skill.summary: Guide users through creating Agent Skills for Claude Code. Use when the user wants to create, write,...
skill.author: pytorch

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides guidance for creating Claude Code skills. The static analyzer detected patterns in markdown documentation (code examples, inline formatting, directory paths) that are false positives. No executable code, network calls, or actual file system access is present.

content.user_title: Create Custom Skills for Claude Code
content.value_statement: Build personalized AI skills that automate your workflows. Follow step-by-step guidance to create Claude Code skills with proper structure, frontmatter, and validation.
actual_capabilities: Guides skill creation with step-by-step instructions from scope to validation
Provides SKILL.md frontmatter templates and YAML examples
Explains personal vs project skill locations and use cases
Offers validation checklists for skill requirements and best practices
Includes troubleshooting guidance for common skill issues
limitations: Does not create skills automatically - provides guidance only
Requires manual file creation and editing by the user
Documentation-only skill with no executable code execution

use_cases.title: Build Custom Development Skills
use_cases.description: Create skills for code analysis, git workflows, or project-specific automation.

use_cases.title: Standardize Team Workflows
use_cases.description: Document and share consistent processes across your team with standardized skills.

use_cases.title: Personalize AI Assistant
use_cases.description: Build custom skills for personal productivity, learning, or hobby projects.

prompt_templates.title: Create a Simple Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a skill that helps me write better commit messages. Can you guide me through creating it?

prompt_templates.title: Skill for Code Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a skill that analyzes Python code for common issues and suggests improvements.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-file Skill Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to create an advanced skill with examples and reference documentation. Show me the proper structure.

prompt_templates.title: Debug Skill Issues
prompt_templates.prompt: My skill has proper structure but Claude won't use it. Help me troubleshoot.

output_examples.input: I want to create a skill that helps me write better commit messages
output: I'll help you create a commit message skill. First, let's clarify the scope:
Determine if it should analyze git diff, support conventional commits, and choose personal or project location.
Then I'll guide you through creating the SKILL.md with proper frontmatter and instructions.

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill that analyzes Python code for issues
output: For a code review skill, place it in .claude/skills/ for team sharing.
Include frontmatter with allowed-tools: Read, Grep, Glob for read-only access.
Add clear instructions for analysis steps and example prompts.

best_practices: Keep skills focused on one specific capability for better reliability
Use specific trigger words in descriptions to help Claude activate the skill
Test skills with real examples before sharing with your team
anti_patterns: Creating overly broad skills that try to do too many things
Using vague descriptions without specific trigger words or use cases
Skipping validation steps before deploying skills to users

faq.question: Where should I create my skills?
faq.answer: Use ~/.claude/skills/ for personal skills or .claude/skills/ for project skills shared via git.

faq.question: Why is my skill not activating?
faq.answer: Add specific trigger words, file types, and user phrases to your description. Include 'Use when...' clauses.

faq.question: Can I restrict tool access in my skill?
faq.answer: Yes, add allowed-tools: with comma-separated tool names like Read, Grep, Glob to frontmatter.

faq.question: How do I test my skill?
faq.answer: Restart Claude Code and ask questions matching your description. Use --debug flag for troubleshooting.

faq.question: What is the maximum description length?
faq.answer: Descriptions must be under 1024 characters and include both what the skill does and when to use it.

faq.question: Can skills include executable scripts?
faq.answer: Yes, skills can reference scripts in subdirectories, but SKILL.md should only contain instructions and examples.
